info.title: Geocoding API
info.description:
Our Geocoding API converts real addresses into these geographic coordinates (latitude/longitude) to be placed on a map, be it for any street, area, postal code, POI or a house number etc.

MapmyIndia Geocoding API Platform provides following advance features:

  • bias
  • podFilter
  • bound

bias

This parameter can be used to set Urban or Rural bias. A positive value sets the Urban bias and a negative value sets Rural bias. Allowed values are:

  • 0 : Default: (No bias)
  • -1 : Rural
  • 1 : Urban

podFilter

This parameter can be used to set admin level restriction. The result will be either the given admin level or equivalent admin or higher in the hierarchy. No lower admin will be considered for geocoding. Allowed values are:

  • hno : house number
  • hna : house name
  • poi : point of interest
  • street : street
  • sslc : sub sub locality
  • village : village
  • slc : sub locality
  • sdist : sub district
  • loc : locality
  • city : city
  • dist : district
  • pincode :pincode/postalcode
  • state : state

bound

This parameter can be used to set admin boundary, which means geocoding will be done within the given admin. The allowed admin bounds are Sub-District, District, City, State and Pincode. The parameter accepts the admin eLoc as value.


Note: Please note that podFilter & bound parameters are mutually exclusive. They cannot be used together in an API call.

Example URL: https://atlas.mapmyindia.com/api/places/geocode?address=mapmyindia 237 okhla phase 3

Security Type

This APIs follow OAuth2 based security. To know more on how to create your authorization tokens, please click the `Authorize` button below. More details available here

  • Live Demo
  • Login/Sing Up for API key and other access.

externalDocs.description: Find out more about MapmyIndia APIs

get.summary: Converts real addresses into these geographic coordinates
get.description: Geocoding API converts real addresses into these geographic coordinates (latitude/longitude) to be placed on a map, be it for any street, area, postal code, POI or a house number etc.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: address to be geocoded e.g. 237 Okhla industrial estate phase 3 new delhi, delhi 110020.

parameters.name: itemCount
parameters.description: parameter can be set to get maximum number of result items from the API (default- 1).

parameters.name: bias
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to set Urban or Rural bias. A positive value sets the Urban bias and a negative value sets Rural bias.(e.g. -1,0,1)

parameters.name: podFilter
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to set admin level restriction. The result will be either the given admin level or equivalent admin or higher in the hierarchy. No lower admin will be considered for geocoding.(e.g.city, locality, poi etc. )

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to set admin boundary, which means geocoding will be done within the given admin. The allowed admin bounds are Sub-District, District, City, State and Pincode. The parameter accepts the admin eLoc as value.

204.description: No matches we’re found for the provided query

400.description: Something’s just not right with the request

403.description: Services for this key has been suspended due to daily/hourly transactions limit

formatedAddress.example: 237, Okhla Industrial Estate Phase 3, Kalkaji, South East Delhi District, New Delhi, Delhi, 110020

eloc.description: Place Id of the location 6-char alphanumeric

confidenceScore.description: the confidence for current of geocodelevel.
